translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The sixteenth section
The discussion of whether form is wholesome or unwholesome
“Is form wholesome?”
“Yes.”

original: Sārammaṇaṁ, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…
analyzed: sārammaṇa atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is it with objects, is there a turning, is there a leaning, is there a tendency?”🔽“You may not say so.”

original: nanu anārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: nanu anārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is it without objects, is there no turning, is there no leaning, is there no tendency?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci anārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhi, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: āmantā  hañci anārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Yes.”
“Then you must say that form is wholesome.”

original: Alobho kusalo sārammaṇo, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: alobho kusalaḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Non-greed is wholesome and has objects, is there a turning, is there a leaning, is there a tendency?”
“Yes.”

original: Rūpaṁ kusalaṁ sārammaṇaṁ, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: rūpam kusalam sa ārammaṇa atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is form wholesome and has objects, is there a turning, is there a leaning, is there a tendency?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  a dosaḥ kusalaḥ pe  a mohaḥ kusalaḥ pe
translated: “You may not say so.”🔽“Non-hate is wholesome …
Non-delusion is wholesome …
Faith …🔽Energy …🔽Mindfulness …
Concentration …

original: paññā kusalā sārammaṇā, atthi tāya āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: paññā kusalā sa ārammaṇā atthi tāya āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: Wisdom is wholesome and has objects, is there a turning, is there a leaning, is there a tendency?”
“Yes.”

original: Rūpaṁ kusalaṁ sārammaṇaṁ, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: rūpam kusalam sa ārammaṇa atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is form wholesome and has objects, is there a turning, is there a leaning, is there a tendency?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: Rūpaṁ kusalaṁ anārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: rūpam kusalam anārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is form that is skillful without object? Is there no inclining, no directing, no aiming of it?”
“Yes.”

original: Alobho kusalo anārammaṇo, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: alobhaḥ kusalaḥ anārammaṇaḥ natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is non-greed that is skillful without object? Is there no inclining, no directing, no aiming of it?”
“That can’t be said.”

original: Rūpaṁ kusalaṁ anārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: rūpam kusalam anārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is form that is skillful without object? Is there no inclining, no directing, no aiming of it?”
“Yes.”
“Is non-hate that is skillful …

original: paññā kusalā anārammaṇā, natthi tāya āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: paññā kusalā anārammaṇā natthi tāya āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is discernment that is skillful without object? Is there no inclining, no directing, no aiming of it?”
“That can’t be said.”
“Is form unskillful?”
“Yes.”

original: Sārammaṇaṁ, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…
analyzed: sārammaṇa atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Is it with object? Is there inclining, directing, aiming of it?”🔽“That can’t be said.”

original: nanu anārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: nanu anārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Isn’t it without object? Is there no inclining, no directing, no aiming of it?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci anārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhi, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci anārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “So it seems that although it’s without object, there is inclining, directing, aiming of it.
“That can’t be said.”

original: Lobho akusalo sārammaṇo, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: lobho akusalaḥ sa ārammaṇaḥ atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is greed that is unskillful with object? Is there inclining, directing, aiming of it?”
“Yes.”

original: Rūpaṁ akusalaṁ sārammaṇaṁ, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe…🔽doso …
analyzed: rūpam akusalam sa ārammaṇa atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe  dosaḥ
translated: “Is it the case that there is a turning around of the unwholesome form that has a cognitive object, and so too a determining, a grasping, and a choosing?”🔽“No.”
“Is it the case that there is a turning around of the unwholesome hate …🔽delusion …
conceit …

original: anottappaṁ akusalaṁ sārammaṇaṁ, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: anottappam akusalam sa ārammaṇa atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: shamelessness that has a cognitive object, and so too a determining, a grasping, and a choosing?”
“Yes.”

original: Rūpaṁ akusalaṁ sārammaṇaṁ, atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: rūpam akusalam sa ārammaṇa atthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is it the case that there is a turning around of the unwholesome form that has a cognitive object, and so too a determining, a grasping, and a choosing?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

original: Rūpaṁ akusalaṁ anārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: rūpam akusalam anārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is it the case that there is no turning around of the unwholesome form that has no cognitive object, and so too no determining, no grasping, and no choosing?”
“Yes.”

original: Lobho akusalo anārammaṇo, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: lobhaḥ akusalaḥ anārammaṇaḥ natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is it the case that there is no turning around of the unwholesome greed that has no cognitive object, and so too no determining, no grasping, and no choosing?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …

original: rūpaṁ akusalaṁ anārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?
analyzed: rūpam akusalam anārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti
translated: “Is it the case that there is no turning around of the unwholesome form that has no cognitive object, and so too no determining, no grasping, and no choosing?”
“Yes.”🔽“Is it the case that there is no turning around of the unwholesome hate …
delusion …

original: anottappaṁ akusalaṁ anārammaṇaṁ, natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā …pe… paṇidhīti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: anottappam akusalam anārammaṇa natthi tassa āvaṭṭanā pe paṇidhi iti  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: shamelessness that has no cognitive object, and so too no determining, no grasping, and no choosing?”🔽“No.”
“It is not to be said

analyzed: rūpam kusalam pi a kusalam pi iti
translated: that form is wholesome and unwholesome.”
“Yes.”

analyzed: nanu kāya kammam vacī kammam kusalam pi akusalam pi iti
translated: “Isn’t bodily action and verbal action skillful and unskillful?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci kāyakammaṁ vacīkammaṁ kusalampi akusalampi, tena vata re vattabbe—🔽“rūpaṁ kusalampi akusalampī”ti.
analyzed: āmantā  hañci kāya kammam vacī kammam kusalam pi akusalam pi tena vata re vattabbe  rūpam kusalam pi a kusalam pi iti
translated: “Yes.”🔽“Then it follows that visible form is skillful and unskillful.”
The Discussion of Visible Form as Skillful and UnSkillful is finished.
